title: Everyone thought autism mostly affected boys. This study says otherwise
description: Autism has long been thought of as a condition that mostly affects boys, but a massive study from Sweden suggests that idea may be misleading. Tracking nearly 3 million people over decades, researchers found that while boys are diagnosed more often in childhood, girls steadily catch up during their teenage years. By early adulthood, autism diagnoses among males and females are nearly equal.

By early adulthood, autism diagnoses among males and females are nearly equal.
